title: How to Uninstall Updates on Google Play Services

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . You can swipe down from the top of your screen to find the gear icon in the Quick Settings panel or you can find the gear app icon on one of your Home screens, by searching, or in the app drawer.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . This might also say "Apps & notifications" depending on your phone's manufacturer.

steps.title: Tap Google Play services.
steps.content: Tap Google Play services . You'll find it in the "G" section of the alphabetical list of applications on your phone.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's in the top right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Uninstall updates.
steps.content: Tap Uninstall updates . Tap Ok to confirm your action and uninstall the updates to Google Play services. If you're having issues uninstalling updates, you may need to disable "Android Device Manager" in Settings > Security > Device Administrators first. [1] X Research source
